CV
Download Full Resume (PDF) ↗

I am an architectural designer and currently a Master of Advanced Architectural Design (MAAD) candidate at UC Berkeley. My design philosophy centers on bridging the gap between advanced digital computation and real-world constructability, exploring how parametric workflows can optimize high-density urban living.

Prior to my graduate studies, I practiced as a Junior Architectural Designer at Pelli Clarke & Partners (PC&P) for 1.5 years. This professional tenure was pivotal in shaping my technical expertise. I transitioned from a part-time role to a core team member, contributing to landmark international projects including The Canal (Dubai), The Al Marjan Island Masterplan and Fairmont Hotel & Apartment.

Beyond technical precision, I possess strong capabilities in architectural visualization, utilizing generative AI tools to enhance production efficiency and elevate visual quality. My work is defined by a rigorous control of geometry and data, specializing in the Rhino-to-Revit workflow to ensure that ambitious design concepts are translated into feasible technical solutions. I am currently seeking an Architectural Designer position starting May 2026.

Selected Experience

Pelli Clarke & Partners (PC&P)

Architectural Intern (Long-term) | Shenzhen | Mar 2024 – Jul 2025
  • Role Transition: Transitioned from part-time to full-time role; served as a core team member on complex international projects.
  • Technical Design: Spearheaded the development of complex curtain wall systems for Fairmont Hotel & Apartment of Al Marjan Island, producing detailed wall sections for constructability.
  • Advanced Workflow: Implemented a seamless Rhino-to-Revit workflow to manage complex massing data for large-scale masterplans.

Honors & Awards
